summary: The Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument Access Act aims to improve access to the Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument in Maine. It allows the Secretary of the Interior to acquire land within a designated area for the monument, prohibiting eminent domain. It details administration of the monument, including provisions for hunting, fishing, fiddlehead fern gathering, public education, and non-commercial timber harvests. The Act mandates public safety measures regarding logging operations and allows for acquiring land for administrative and visitor facilities.
